item.title: 香港电台称股票印花税或将影响香港营运盈余
item.description: 财政司司长陈茂波周六接受香港电台采访时表示，股票交易印花税收入的增加，可能使香港政府日常预算早于预期恢复盈余。【原文：Higher stock trading stamp duty revenue may enable the Hong Kong government to return its day-to-day budget back to a surplus sooner than expected, Financial Secretary Paul Chan told RTHK on Saturday.】

item.title: 埃及通胀率保持稳定，或为进一步降息创造空间
item.description: 埃及12月通胀率持平，这可能为央行在2026年进一步下调借贷成本创造空间。【原文：Egypt’s inflation rate was unchanged in December, potentially giving the central bank scope to further cut borrowing costs in 2026.】

item.title: 斯塔默过去的不受欢迎或许正是拯救他的关键
item.description: 据党内人士透露，英国工党日益萎缩的党员群体可能比普遍认为的更倾向于保留基尔·斯塔默的首相职位——这一因素可能削弱今年试图将其赶下台的竞争对手的势头。【原文：The UK Labour Party’s dwindling membership may be more in favor of keeping Keir Starmer as prime minister than is widely believed, according to party insiders — a factor that could undermine rivals seeking to oust him this year.】

item.title: 瑞士就业的秘诀是梅尔茨梦寐以求的典范
item.description: 瑞士经济的韧性彰显了欧洲最亲商地区之一的实力，在此类地区，企业解雇员工时几乎不受惩罚。【原文：Switzerland’s economic resilience is showcasing the prowess of one of Europe’s most business-friendly domains, where companies can fire workers with relative impunity.】

item.title: 香港致命火灾中的房产不会被重新用作住房，香港电台称
item.description: 香港政府无意将这座在近八十年来最致命火灾中被毁的屋邨重新用作住宅区，一名政府官员向香港电台表示。【原文：The Hong Kong government doesn’t plan to reuse the devastated housing estate that was involved in the city’s deadliest fire in nearly eight decades as a residential area, a government minister told broadcaster RTHK.】

item.title: 印度经济顾问称低通胀助力经济增长
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉·莫迪的一位重要顾问表示，印度经济具有韧性，预计将成为全球增长最快的经济体，这得益于低通胀水平和金融稳定的支撑。【原文：The Indian economy is resilient and expected to be the world’s fastest-growing, buoyed by low inflation and underpinned by financial stability, according to a key adviser to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.】

item.title: 墨西哥石油运抵古巴，加剧与美国紧张关系
item.description: 一艘载有8.5万至9万桶原油的油轮从墨西哥抵达哈瓦那。此前委内瑞拉被罢免总统尼古拉斯·马杜罗上周下台后，美国与该国围绕石油运输的紧张局势持续升级。【原文：A tanker carrying between 85,000 and 90,000 barrels of oil arrived in Havana from Mexico amid growing tensions with the US over the shipments after the fall of Venezuela’s ousted President Nicolás Maduro last week.】

item.title: 沃尔玛将于1月20日加入纳斯达克100指数，阿斯利康则将退出该指数。
item.description: 纳斯达克全球指数公司周五宣布，沃尔玛公司将加入纳斯达克100指数，取代阿斯利康公司。【原文：Walmart Inc. will join the Nasdaq 100 Index, replacing AstraZeneca Plc, Nasdaq Global Indexes said Friday.】

item.title: 美国证交会将撤销对力拓前首席财务官的长期欺诈指控
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会撤销了对力拓集团前首席财务官盖伊·埃利奥特的欺诈诉讼。此前八年，该机构曾指控埃利奥特等人虚增了该公司2011年收购非洲煤炭资产的价值，该交易最终以惨败告终。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission is dropping a fraud lawsuit against former Rio Tinto Ltd. chief financial officer Guy Elliott, eight years after accusing him and others of inflating the value of African coal assets the company acquired in a disastrous 2011 deal.】

item.title: 维拉德米克斯公司申请首次公开募股以筹集资金用于研发生发药丸
item.description: 维拉德米克斯公司已提交首次公开募股申请，旨在推动其生发药片的商业化进程。【原文：Veradermics Inc. filed for an initial public offering to help commercialize its hair re-growth pill.】

item.title: 投资者迈克尔·布里揭露做空甲骨文股票的期权押注
item.description: 迈克尔·巴里——这位因近期批评人工智能热潮而备受瞩目的著名投资者——正押注甲骨文公司股价将下跌。【原文：Michael Burry, the famed investor who has drawn attention in recent months for criticism of the artificial intelligence boom, is betting against Oracle Corp.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚领导人与特朗普缓和关系后重启对美批评
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃·佩特罗在与唐纳德·特朗普通电话后本周短暂缓和了批评态度，但随后再度对美国政策提出批评。【原文：Colombian President Gustavo Petro renewed his criticism of US policy after briefly softening his tone this week following a phone call with Donald Trump.】

item.title: Eikon Therapeutics Files for IPO Led By Merck Veterans
item.description: Eikon Therapeutics Inc. filed for an initial public offering to help fund its advanced pipeline of cancer drugs.

item.title: The Trump Administration’s Case for Venezuela’s Oil
item.description: On today’s Big Take podcast: President Trump has big plans for Venezuela’s oil. What will it take to make them a reality?

item.title: Rio-Glencore Deal Closer Than Ever With Premium and CEO in Focus
item.description: Glencore Plc boss Gary Nagle has called it the most obvious deal in mining. His predecessor and mentor Ivan Glasenberg has been trying to pull it off for nearly two decades. And yet the merger of Glencore with Rio Tinto Group has proven elusive – until now.

item.title: Data Center Electrical Equipment Maker Forgent Files for US IPO
item.description: Forgent Power Solutions Inc., a designer and manufacturer of electrical equipment used in data centers, filed for a US initial public offering.

item.title: KKR Chief Operating Officer Ryan Stork Steps Down From Role
item.description: KKR & Co. Chief Operating Officer Ryan Stork is stepping down from his role effective immediately, the firm said in a regulatory filing.

item.title: Supreme Court to Weigh FCC Power to Fine in New Regulatory Clash
item.description: The US Supreme Court will consider invalidating the Federal Communications Commission’s system for imposing financial penalties in a clash that could put fresh limits on the power of federal regulators.

item.title: Hedge Funds Turn More Bullish on Oil Amid Venezuela, Iran Unrest
item.description: Hedge funds hiked bullish wagers on US crude to a five-month high as the initial shock of the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro gave way to fears of stunted oil flows from the Middle East as deadly protests grip Iran.

item.title: Wall Street's Risk-On Fever Shows No Signs of Abating in New Year
item.description: Wall Street’s risk complex is booming anew. In the first full week of 2026, a synchronized cross-asset rally — from meme stocks and high-yield bonds to small-company shares — shows no sign of slowing.

item.title: Small Stocks Are Crushing It, But Investors Still Hate Them
item.description: Small-cap stocks are soaring, and investors have never been so eager to sell them

item.title: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, RBC picked for First Student IPO
item.description: EQT AB-backed First Student Inc. has selected banks to arrange an initial public offering of the student transportation company, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: EquipmentShare, Motive to Weigh Marketing IPOs Next Week
item.description: EquipmentShare.com Inc. and Motive Technologies Inc. are set to begin formal marketing for their initial public offerings as soon as next week, according to people familiar with the matter, as a busy year for listings gets underway.

item.title: Walmart-Backed ‘Super App’ OnePay Hits $4 Billion Valuation
item.description: OnePay, the Walmart Inc.-backed fintech firm behind the “super app” that the world’s largest retailer is incorporating for customers, recently bought back shares from employees at a price that values the closely-held company at more than $4 billion, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

item.title: First Brands Sues Founder’s Brother, Largest Creditor for Fraud
item.description: Bankrupt auto-parts maker First Brands Group has sued Edward James — its former executive and the brother of company founder Patrick James — and its largest creditor Onset Financial for conspiring “to defraud creditors out of billions of dollars and property.”

item.title: Amazon Has Big Hopes for Wearable AI — Starting With This $50 Gadget
item.description: Several months after Amazon.com Inc. bought artificial intelligence hardware startup Bee, the company said it’s working to make its $50 always-listening wearable more proactive, and indicated a larger revamp is in store.

item.title: Hedge Fund D1’s SpaceX Bet Fuels Its 39% Private Book Gain
item.description: D1 Capital Partners’ portfolio of private investments climbed 39% last year — powered by a bet on Elon Musk’s SpaceX, which nabbed an $800 billion valuation last month.

item.title: Amazon Is Planning Walmart-Style Big Box Store Near Chicago
item.description: Amazon.com Inc. is planning a 229,000-square-foot store selling groceries and general merchandise in the Chicago area, a fresh attempt at physical retail that borrows from the big-box store model of such competitors as Walmart Inc. and Target Corp.

item.title: Trump’s $200 Billion MBS Order Asserts New Power Over Markets
item.description: With his directive ordering Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to buy $200 billion of mortgage bonds, President Donald Trump has opened a new front in the administration’s effort to bolster housing affordability.

item.title: OpenAI, SoftBank Invest $1 Billion in Stargate Partner SB Energy
item.description: OpenAI与软银集团共同向基础设施公司SB Energy注资10亿美元。该公司正与科技企业合作，在美国大规模建设数据中心以支持人工智能发展。【原文：OpenAI and SoftBank Group Corp. have jointly invested $1 billion in SB Energy, an infrastructure company that’s working with the tech firms on a massive US buildout of data centers to power artificial intelligence.】
